metadata.Title: CVE-2022-44617 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in libXpm. When processing a file with width of 0 and a very large height, some parser functions will be called repeatedly and can lead to an infinite loop, resulting in a Denial of Service in the application linked to the library.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxpm4 - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu1
xpmutils - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> motif contains a vendored copy of libxpm under lib/Xm/ with files prefixed by Xpm eg. the file src/parse.c in libxpm is lib/Xm/Xpmparse.c

criterions.comment: libxpm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.12-1ubuntu1').
motif package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
